intro: Neoalsomitra, commonly known as the red-flowered alismatoid, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Alismataceae. It is characterized by its aquatic or semi-aquatic habitat, often found in wetlands and marshy areas. The plants typically have narrow, ribbon-like leaves and produce showy, clustered flowers in shades of red or pink. Neoalsomitra species are known for their ability to thrive in nutrient-rich, freshwater environments. They play an important ecological role in supporting aquatic biodiversity.
